Scoping Memo and Ruling of Assigned Commissioner and Administrative Law Judge.  The scope and schedule are as set forth; the category is confirmed as ratesetting; hearings may be required; and the presiding officer is ALJ Roscow.  In addition:  
(1) Opening Comments on the utilities' proposed Phase 1 Flex Alert activities and budgets due no later than February 1, 2013.  Reply Comments on the utilities' proposed Phase 1 Flex Alert activities and budgets due no later than February 8, 2013.  
(2) Final statewide ME&O plan due no later than February 25, 2013.  
(3) Opening Comments on Phase 2 issues due no later than March 13, 2013.  Reply Comments on Phase 2 issues due no later than March 22, 2013.

filings.description: On November 1, 2013, Ted Reguly, Director of Customer Programs and Projects of San Diego Gas & Electric Company (SDG&E), had a roundtable discussion and later a separate meeting with Michael Colvin, Advisor to Cmmr. Ferron, at SDG&E's Energy Innovation Center, 4760 Clairemont Mesa Boulevard, San Diego, California.  Also present were SDG&E's representatives as well as representatives from SDG&E's Local Government Partners (a list of all attendees is attached to the notice). Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.  At the separate meeting with Michael Colvin also present were Athena Besa, Customer Programs Policy Manager, and Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, for SDG&E.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

filings.description: On November 1, 2013, Ted Reguly, Director of Customer Programs and Projects of San Diego Gas & Electric Company (SDG&E), had a roundtable discussion and later a separate meeting with Michael Colvin, Advisor to Cmmr. Ferron, at SDG&E's Energy Innovation Center, 4760 Clairemont Mesa Boulevard, San Diego, California.  Also present were SDG&E's representatives as well as representatives from SDG&E's Local Government Partners (a list of all attendees is attached to the notice). Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.  At the separate meeting with Michael Colvin also present were Athena Besa, Customer Programs Policy Manager, and Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, for SDG&E.

Parties shall comply with ex parte rules set forth in Rule 8.2 and 8.3 and Public Utilities Code Section 1701.3(c). Administrative Law Judge Roscow shall be the presiding officer in this proceeding.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

filings.description:
Scoping Memo and Ruling of Assigned Commissioner and Administrative Law Judge.  The scope and schedule are as set forth; the category is confirmed as ratesetting; hearings may be required; and the presiding officer is ALJ Roscow.  In addition:  
(1) Opening Comments on the utilities' proposed Phase 1 Flex Alert activities and budgets due no later than February 1, 2013.  Reply Comments on the utilities' proposed Phase 1 Flex Alert activities and budgets due no later than February 8, 2013.  
(2) Final statewide ME&O plan due no later than February 25, 2013.  
(3) Opening Comments on Phase 2 issues due no later than March 13, 2013.  Reply Comments on Phase 2 issues due no later than March 22, 2013.

filings.description: On November 1, 2013, Ted Reguly, Director of Customer Programs and Projects of San Diego Gas & Electric Company (SDG&E), had a roundtable discussion and later a separate meeting with Michael Colvin, Advisor to Cmmr. Ferron, at SDG&E's Energy Innovation Center, 4760 Clairemont Mesa Boulevard, San Diego, California.  Also present were SDG&E's representatives as well as representatives from SDG&E's Local Government Partners (a list of all attendees is attached to the notice). Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.  At the separate meeting with Michael Colvin also present were Athena Besa, Customer Programs Policy Manager, and Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, for SDG&E.

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.

Scoping Ruling filed by CMMR/PICKER/CPUC on 04/10/2018 Conf# 119439 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 10, 2018, Laura Genao, Managing Director of Regulatory Affairs, Southern California Edison Company (SCE), met with Maria Sotero, advisor to Cmmr. Guzman Aceves, in San Francisco. Russell Garwacki, Director of Pricing, Design and Research, SCE, participated in the meeting by telephone. SCE’s representatives discussed SCE’s proposed TOU periods, specifically noting that SCE’s proposed TOU periods align with the state’s GHG goals and previous CPUC direction on TOU periods, and that an expeditious decision in this proceeding is necessary in order to enable the implementation of the proposed TOU periods.

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 11, 2018, Laura Genao, Managing Director of Regulatory Affairs, Southern California Edison Company (SCE), met with Ehren Seybert, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, and on April 12 – with David Peck, advisor to Cmmr. Picker, in San Francisco. Russell Garwacki, Director of Pricing, Design and Research, SCE, also attended the meeting of April 11th, and participated in the meeting of April 12th by telephone. Erin Pulgar, Senior Advisor of State Regulatory Operations, SCE, also participated in the meeting of April 12th by telephone. SCE’s representatives discussed SCE’s proposed TOU periods, specifically noting that SCE’s proposed TOU periods align with the state’s GHG goals and previous CPUC direction on TOU periods, and that an expeditious decision in this proceeding is necessary in order to enable the implementation of the proposed TOU periods. Written material (attached to the notice) was used.

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On October 9, 2018, Brian Prusnek, Director of Regulatory Affairs, Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Manager of Regulatory Relations, and Cyndee Fang, Manager of Customer Pricing, of Diego Gas & Electric Company (SDG&E), met with Joanna Gubman and Anand Durvasala, advisors to Cmmr. Randolph, in San Francisco. Jason Houck, advisor to Cmmr. Randolph, participated by telephone. SDG&E representatives discussed the unprecedented and sustained heatwave that hit San Diego this summer and the resulting high bills and customer complaints. SDG&E representatives informed that in an effort to respond to their customers concerns SDG&E is in the process of developing several potential solutions to provide customers with a better customer experience that may be filed with the CPUC in the near future. Written material (attached to the notice) was used.

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On October 18, 2018, Brian Prusnek, Director of Regulatory Affairs, and Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Manager of Regulatory Relations of San Diego Gas & Electric Company (SDG&E), met with Maria Sotero, advisor to Cmmr. Guzman Aceves, and Paul Phillips, Whitney Richardson and Masoud Foudeh, of the Energy Division, in San Francisco. Cyndee Fang, Manager of Customer Pricing of SDG&E, participated by telephone. SDG&E discussed the unprecedented and sustained heatwave that hit San Diego this summer along with the resulting high bills and customer complaints. SDG&E stated that it is developing several potential solutions to provide better customer experience and the findings may be filed with the CPUC in the near future. Written material (attached to the notice) was used.

documents.title: Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806
Ruling filed by ALJ/Roscow/CPUC on 04/07/2016 Conf# 96806 (Certificate Of Service)

filings.description: SUMMARY:  On April 5, 2016, Ann Ayres, Director of Customer Engagement and Insights for Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas), met with Joanna Gubman, advisor to Cmmr. Peterman, in San Francisco. Also present were Kari Kloberdanz-Yu, Regulatory Relations Manager, and Dan Rendler, Director of Customer Programs and Assistance, for SoCalGas; and Gene Rodrigues, Vice President, for ICF International.  Rodrigues discussed a presentation created in response to the March 15, 2016 ruling of Assigned Cmmr. Peterman encouraging Marketing, Education & Outreach (ME&O) activities for energy conservation in response to Aliso Canyon.  Rodrigues described ICF’s extensive expertise to handle this robust campaign.  Rendler discussed the coordination that is already and will continue to occur with various stakeholders. Ayres discussed the different types of media and engagement that are a part of the campaign. Kloberdanz-Yu highlighted that the campaign is ready to be deployed quickly. Written materials (attached to the notice) were used.
